text:
I’m a bit confused about what approach to use for building emails for clients.

There is a new drag and drop editor, but I can’t seem to make templates and the width seems to be fixed to 600px? I have changed the content width in settings/marketing/email but can’t see it change.

There’s a drag and drop template type, but I can’t seem to find how I set the layout and design for this template?

Last resort is to code it from scratch but client feels locked down using this approach.

What are the recommendations?

Let me double check for you :+1: I know that there’s currently a couple engineers working on it but I’m not actually part of the Marketing Email product team anymore so I’m a little out of the loop :slightly_smiling_face:
You cannot create templates for the dnd as you've sumized

I have built a little automated workflow that uses mjml -> HS module html. I currently use coded templates, but my goal is using the coded modules in the DND editor. Just need massage the additional head content a bit
working to get it in a isolated repo so others can use. right now its all tangled with my site code

Quick sit-rep, they’re expecting to have a beta of this in a couple weeks :+1: it’ll provide the ability to create a template for the drag and drop email tool via the email editor, but won’t yet include the ability to create one from a template in Design Manager. That is going to come, but unfortunately it’s a different project for the team.
I'm a big fan of MJML. I didn't know that you can take a coded file and use it in the DND editor. Do you any documentation or articles handy that I could use to read about that?
